results.title: Common ground: Youth Summit 2006
results.brief_description:
‘Youth summit 2006’ is an inspirational collection of works from young people who, through their association with the Western Chances program, have been given the opportunity to tell their stories and build their own bridge to the future. Common Ground is part of the First Person: International Digital Storytelling Conference.
Western Chances was established to ensure that financial hardship does not prevent a young person in Melbourne’s West from achieving their maximum potential in life.

results.title: Common fallacies about group differences
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
A painter working in a classroom makes a statement about the French race and Latin temperament. A professor, over-hearing his remark, tries to correct his misconceptions. Among other facts, he points out that a nation is not a race, that members of a group are never “all anything”, that group behaviour cannot be judged by isolated cases.

results.title: Commodore C2N Datasette
results.brief_description: The Commodore 1530 (C2N) Datasette, later also Datassette (a portmanteau of data and cassette), is Commodore’s dedicated magnetic tape data storage device. Using compact cassettes as the storage medium, it provides inexpensive storage to Commodore’s 8-bit home/personal computers, notably the PET, VIC-20, and C64.

Using compact cassettes as the storage medium, it provides inexpensive storage to Commodore’s 8-bit home/personal computers, notably the PET, VIC-20, and C64.

results.title: Commodore 64 Console and Cassettes
results.brief_description: Consoles and personal computers are common in homes today, but back in 1982 they were pretty rare. Enter the Commodore 64, a wildly popular 8-bit home computer console that was a major contributor to the home computer revolution. With over 17 million units sold worldwide, it was the highest selling single computer at the time and was often used to run educational resources and games. In Australia alone, over 700 games were produced for the Commodore 64. Software was originally released on audio cassette before 5 ¼ inch floppy discs (and later 3½ inch floppy discs) became more common during the 1980s, which we’ve worked to locate, acquire and preserve.

constellations_other.name: Beyond the game industry
constellations_other.description: While the game industry garners a lot of publicity, digital games have long been created outside the official industry, and the social and cultural significance of games has always exceeded official channels.

results.title: Commodore 64 Console
results.brief_description:
Commodore 64 Console without joysticks or power cords
Serial Number WGB 28483
results.description:
The Commodore 64 (C64) is an 8-bit home computer console that was in production from 1982-1994. It has been listed as the highest selling single computer model of all time – over 17million units were sold worldwide. The C64 took its name from its 64 kilobytes (65,536 bytes) of RAM. With support for multicolour sprites and a custom chip for waveform generation, the C64 could create superior visuals and audio compared to systems without such custom hardware. Because of this, the C64 was often used as a home gaming console, with accessories such as datasettes and gaming joysticks.
The Commodore 64 holds a unique place in the history of video games. Institutions such as the National Museum of American History and the Science Museum London also hold Commodore 64 consoles in their collections to highlight the impact and significance the C64 had on computing and home video games.
description_for_label:
Commodore 64 Console without joysticks or power cords
Serial Number WGB 28483

results.title: Commitment
results.creator_credit: Daryl Wayland, Country Education Project and David Zweck
results.brief_description: Jocelyn Terry leads a discussion with Laurie Clancy of La Trobe University and Colin Goodwin of the Phillip Institute, in aspects of commitment as revealed in Thomas Keneally’s book “Schindler’s Ark” and in Graham Greene’s book “The Power and the Glory”. Some provocative considerations emerge about the varieties of commitment, motivations for and consequences of commitment, as revealed in these texts.

results.title: Commercial sexual exploitation of children
results.creator_credit: ECPAT Australia, Gail Price and Nicholas Bird
results.brief_description: Discusses the global issue of commercial exploitation of children and the various forms this abuse can take, eg prostitution, slave-trade, pedophilia, internet pornography. Mentions some of the causes as being poverty, homelessness, consumerism, absence of child protection, cultural and traditional practices and a growing child sex tourist trade. Also talks about positive strategies that can be taken at all levels, local, regional, national and international. ECPAT is an international network of organisations committed to ending the commercial exploitation of children. Formed in 1991, ECPAT now reaches to over 50 countries globally and closely works with various government departments, such as Tourism and Child Welfare. Cast: Michael Brakensiek, Sarah Hill, Michael Williams, Afshin Nikousheresht. Narration: Patrick J. Bonello, Damian Nicholas.

results.title: Commercial art
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Several years of full-time study requiring imagination, patience and the ability to express ideas in words, as well as in pictures. Stresses that even after training, a job may be hard to find. Shows a young artist in an advertising agency learning to accept criticism of simple jobs, before moving on to more demanding work.

results.title: Commerce
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, John Leake, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
A look at Australia’s image within the world of commerce in the 1980’s - its transportation, stock exchanges, futures markets, and its growth in the cattle, produce and minerals industries. Suitable for lower secondary level.
